oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-08-09 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 9, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer - although Porter Wagoner was advertised as the host for this week on the previous show), guest performer Hank Locklin, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Hugh Jarrett and the Tonespinners, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 983rd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Rod Brasfield; Hank Locklin; Tommy Jackson; Hugh Jarrett; Tonespinners
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- I'm Moving On (Hank Snow) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Hank Locklin -- Send Me The Pillow That You Dream On (Hank Locklin) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Tommy Jackson -- Ragtime Annie (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Hank Snow talks -- The Old Rugged Cross (Hank Snow, Hugh Jarrett and the Tonespinners)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Brasfield, Rod; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Wise, Chubby; Jarrett, Hugh; Snow, Hank; Locklin, Hank
